title: Futuristic, Techy font
content:
Hi All,

I'm looking for a font as extended as Blair and Zeppelin, but with a techy, futuristic edge. Something you could potentially see in Wired Magazine.

Thanks!
author: talgoretsky

comments.content:
I don't know if you'd see them in Wired, but these fit your description:

[Cavalero](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/bitstream/cavalero_ot/)  
 [Changeling](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/mark_simonson/changeling/)  
 [FF QType](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_qtype_extended_ot/)  
 [Aggie](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/aggie_normal_ot_std_urw/)  
 [ITC Flatiron](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/itc_flatiron/)  
 [Shimano Square](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/font_bureau/shimano_square/)  
 [FF Beekman](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_beekman/)  
 [FF Trademarker](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_trademarker/)  
 [Neuropol](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/neuropol-x/?refby=typographica)

F U T U R E \<- read aloud in simulated vocoder voice

[RendtPhysic](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dooleytype/rendtphysic/)  
 [Jakita](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/device/jakita/)  
 [Zosma](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/typodermic.com/42.html)  
 [Avaloc](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dooleytype/avaloc/)  
 [Amp](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/amp/)  
 [Injekuta](http://web.archive.org/web/20111217180613/http:/www.typodermic.com/134.html)
